Question: After a series of try-outs in Connecticut and New Jersey, this person announced she would open the play in New York.
Hints: This person's parents married on January 18, 1889, in Brooklyn and reared their children as Protestant.
Due to the numerous changes, this person agreed to have her lines fed to her through a speaker concealed in her wig.
This person was an early supporter of the women's liberation movement, but said she was not a feminist.
